Package Assignment

Class DateCheck

java.lang.Object
Assignment.DateCheck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DateCheck extends Object implements Serializable
Checks whether: 1. Guests check-in before stipulated timing If guest have not checked-in by the check-in timing, reservation will be cancelled. Room status will be updated accordingly. 2. Guest checks-out before stipulated timing If guest have not checked-out by stipulated check-out timing, guests will be evicted. Room status will be updated accordingly. 3. Room service status is updated according to the current time and preparation time.
Author:
joel, jin rui, jamie, tan yu

  • Constructor Details

    • DateCheck

      public DateCheck()

  • Method Details

    • performChecks

      public static void performChecks(Date dt, ReservationsDB DataBase, RoomServiceDB rsDB) throws ParseException
      Perform the 3 date checking methods mentioned in class description.
      Parameters:
      dt - The current time during the running of the system. It is set as 1st of April, 2022, 00:00:00 when the code starts running.
      DataBase - The reservation database. A global reservation database will be passed in as argument.
      rsDB - The room service database. A global room service database will be passed in as argument.
      Throws:
      ParseException - Throws an exception if parsing done in the three methods: checkCheckOut, checkRoomService, checkCheckIn, results in a parse exception due to them not being in the Date format.

    • getZeroTimeDate

      public static Date getZeroTimeDate(Date date1)
      Setting the current date's timing as 00:00:00 to mark the start of the specified day.
      Parameters:
      date1 - The current date passed in as argument. When the code starts running, the current date will be automatically set as 1st of April, 2022.
      Returns:
      The current date, with its time set to 00:00:00 will be returned.

    • checkCheckOut

      public static void checkCheckOut(Date dt, ReservationsDB DataBase) throws ParseException
      Checks if guests have already checked-out at the stipulated time. If not, guests will be evicted and their reservations will be deleted.
      Parameters:
      dt - The current date passed in as argument. When the code starts running, the current date will be automatically set as 1st of April, 2022.
      DataBase - The reservation database. A global reservation database will be passed in as argument.
      Throws:
      ParseException - Throws an exception if parsing of the check-out date of a specific reservation results in a parse exception.

    • checkRoomService

      public static void checkRoomService(Date dt, ReservationsDB DataBase, RoomServiceDB rsDB) throws ParseException
      Checks if each room service status has to be updated.
      Parameters:
      dt - The current date passed in as argument. When the code starts running, the current date will be automatically set as 1st of April, 2022.
      DataBase - The reservation database. A global reservation database will be passed in as argument.
      rsDB - The room service database. A global room service database will be passed in as argument.
      Throws:
      ParseException - Throws an exception if parsing of the check-out date of a specific reservation results in a parse exception.

    • checkCheckIn

      public static void checkCheckIn(Date dt, ReservationsDB DataBase) throws ParseException
      Checks if guests check-in on time. If not, remove their reservation.
      Parameters:
      dt - The current date passed in as argument. When the code starts running, the current date will be automatically set as 1st of April, 2022.
      DataBase - The reservation database. A global reservation database will be passed in as argument.
      Throws:
      ParseException - Throws an exception if parsing of the check-in date of a specific reservation results in a parse exception.
